A Great Day at the SF Bay

Driving up from San Jose we were in San Francisco for fun. The bay is a highlight and it was beautiful and clear so the bay was blue. Alcatraz Island looked appealing there in the middle of the bay. We didn't take the boat out, though, because we didn't have that much time. Instead, we drove across the Golden Gate Bridge and looked at both coasts (San Francisco and Marin), spotted some ships and sail boats in the water, and studied the newest skyscraper, among many, on the SF side. Later, when we drove back from Marin, we went along the Presidio (now a national park) and through Golden Gate Park. We only saw a portion of the bay but there's so much to see on the surrounding land - the natural beauty, the neighborhoods, the marinas, etc. - that you can't see all that the bay has in one day. I've driven around the entire perimeter and just doing that took a couple of hours, mainly because of uneven access, i.e., the variety of roads and highways that circle the bay. It's better to explore one portion and enjoy the time getting to know the land and sea marks that make up SF Bay.

If one comes to S F you should consider weather, time of year and what you can do via public transportation.

Best months in the city are Sept through Nov since the coldest time is during July and August. Bring a jacket, sweater/sweatshirt and long pants.

In the Summer/Fall we have local street fairs and baseball so keep this in mind. Consider getting a 1, 3 or 7 day City Pass to use on the bus, Metro and/or Cable Car. The City Pass can be purchased by the Powell St Cable Car turn table or the SF Cable Car Museum. Worth it to have for a visit in the city.

S F offers so much to see and do. There are activities to keep in mind for kids - Golden Gate Park, S F Zoo, the Exploratorium, California Academy of Science just to name a few.

Do your homework before coming so you can enjoy the City by the Bay!

First things first - realize that Fisherman's Warf is a tourist trap and be okay with that! We didn't spend too much time here since we wanted to obviously explore SF and not get trapped here spending insane amounts of money but we got a great lunch at Boudin's - the sourdough bread bowls are worth it. We picked up some souvenirs for family back home - this was great since there were multiple shops lined up here and it made it easy to find something for everyone on our respective lists in 1 trip so we could spend the rest of our time actually exploring the city. We got some cookies at Mrs. Fields because they don't have them back home anymore and they are delicious! :) And then - the main reason for us coming down to the Bay was to see those Sea Lions!! We had the most fun watching them and I honestly could have spent the whole afternoon giggling at their antics. It was quite crowded on a Saturday afternoon though so we headed out when we ran out of breathing room but going on a less busy day and hanging out there to watch them would have been a great way to spend a few hours in my opinion. Yes, this place is full of gimmicks - there was even a magic show going on in the middle of the plaza when we were going through but it was a fun little experience and the food was good and it was super great to get all the souvenir shopping out of the way in 1 shot and the Sea Lions were definitely a highlight of our trip.

So I say go - but just know when to leave.
